item.title: Why I Left Rust
item.description: - An expert in the field was disgraced by Rust and RustConf for having a controversial blog post on reflection in Rust.

item.title: YouTube removed dislike counts, so this guy made Rotten Tomatoes for YouTube
item.description: - YouTube made the decision to make dislike counts private across the entire service, removing a valuable metric for viewers to evaluate YouTube videos.

item.title: Health officials delayed report linking fluoride to brain harm
item.description: - A long-awaited report by the National Toxicology Program (NTP) on the possible cognitive and neurodevelopmental impacts of fluoride exposure in humans was delayed by the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) after criticism from health and dental organizations advocating for community water fluoridation.

item.title: Lua: The Little Language That Could
item.description: - Lua is a simple and easy-to-learn programming language used in various software, including Redis, NGINX, Wireshark, World of Warcraft, and Roblox.

item.title: Rust: The wrong people are resigning
item.description: - A former member of two private online discussion spaces for Rust people expresses disappointment in the poor execution or lack of resources/process/manpower when dealing with drama within the community.

item.title: ARM's Cortex A53: Tiny but Important
item.description: - ARM's Cortex A53 is a low-power CPU, optimized for power efficiency and non-CPU sensitive tasks.

item.title: Libuv â€“ Linux: io_uring support
item.description: - Libuv, an open-source library that provides asynchronous I/O capabilities, has introduced support for io_uring on Linux.

item.title: Octopuses are building small "cities" off the coast of Australia (2017)
item.description: - Octopuses, known to be solitary animals, have been found building their own "cities" off the coast of Australia.

item.title: The Gemini protocol seen by this HTTP client person
item.description: - Gemini is a new wire protocol and documentation format emerging from a movement against developments considered wrong on the current web.

item.title: Private spies hired by FBI & corporations infiltrate Discord, Reddit, WhatsApp
item.description: - Surveillance firms known as "threat intelligence" are creating fake online personas to gain access to private corners of the web, including Discord, Reddit, WhatsApp, and dark web message boards.
